meanings.definition: Enserfs: to make someone a serf or slave
meanings.sent1: The evil sorcerer enserfs the villagers, forcing them to work without pay.
meanings.sent2: The cruel dictator enserfs his people, depriving them of their freedom.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fairy enserfs the grumpy troll, making him do her bidding.
meanings.sent4: The dark magic enserfs the once free land, binding it in chains of oppression.
meanings.sent5: The wicked witch enserfs the prince, turning him into a mindless servant.

meanings.definition: Enserfs: to subject someone to feudal servitude
meanings.sent1: The king enserfs the peasants, making them work the fields for his benefit.
meanings.sent2: The lord enserfs the commoners, imposing heavy taxes and labor on them.
meanings.sent3: The queen enserfs the court jester, making him entertain her day and night.
meanings.sent4: The warlord enserfs the defeated army, making them swear allegiance to him.
meanings.sent5: The baron enserfs the villagers, controlling every aspect of their lives.
